page.title: 04SUSSEX COUNTY HOSPITAL
page.content: The Royal Sussex County Hospital, first opened in 1828 by Sir Thomas Kemp, is now a centre for a wide range of general and specialised care. The hospital has over 400 beds and employs about 1700 medical, nursing, administrative and supporting staff, both full and part time. The Opthalmology Unit in the Hospital cares for patients of all ages, there are usually 30 beds in this section. The Hospital also cares for catoracts; this is when the lens of the eye becomes extremely cloudy and eventually results in the lining of the eye coming away. This unit also cares for squints and does a drainage operation on the eye to lower the pressure. The nearest eye hospital is Maidstone (Kent) and so people come from all over Sussex to use the help of this specialist unit.
